settings.label: Fast Weapon Switch
settings.tooltip: If set, you can change weapons without using the weapon selection menu.

settings.label: Enable Minimal HUD
settings.tooltip: Minimal HUD mode uses a smaller, denser HUD so that you can see more. Some explanatory information is removed as well, so you should be familiar with the standard HUD before you turn on Minimal HUD.

settings.label: HUD Aspect Ratio
settings.tooltip: Will constrain certain elements of the HUD to fit to the center of the screen based upon the aspect ratio chosen.

settings.label: Hide HUD During Freezecam Screenshots
settings.tooltip: If set, the HUD will be hidden during freezecam screenshots.

settings.label: Disable Floating Health Bar
settings.tooltip: If set, removes the TargetID HealthBar floating over the character's head.

settings.label: TargetID Translucency
settings.tooltip: Set the translucency of the TargetID name plate

settings.label: Display Ping Values as Text on the Scoreboard
Display Alternate Class Icons on the Scoreboard
Use the Team Status Display in the HUD
Disable HTML MOTDs
settings.tooltip: If set, you won't be shown HTML versions of server's Message of the Day welcome screens.

settings.label: Show Pop-up Alerts While In-Game
settings.tooltip: If set, you'll receive in-game notification popups for various events, like trade requests. If unset, these notifications will only be visible when you return to the main menu.

settings.label: Featured Class on Main Menu
settings.tooltip: Choose which class is featured on the main menu.

settings.label: Chat History Lines
settings.tooltip: The number of lines to keep in the chat history. Setting this higher will allow you to scroll back further to see previous messages, but may cause performance issues on some computers.

settings.label: Enable Hitsounds
settings.tooltip: If set, you'll hear a 'hit sound' that's played whenever you damage an enemy.

settings.label: Hitsound Volume
settings.tooltip: The volume for 'hit sounds'.

settings.label: Hitsound Pitch Min Damage
settings.tooltip: Hit sound pitch for attacks that deal 10 damage or less. Pitch scales between high and low values. (Recommended: 155)

settings.label: Hitsound Pitch Max Damage
settings.tooltip: Hit sound pitch for attacks that deal 150 damage or more. Pitch scales between high and low values. (Recommended: 50)

settings.label: Enable Killsounds
settings.tooltip: If set, you'll hear a last hit sound when one of your attacks kills an enemy.

settings.label: Killsound Volume
settings.tooltip: The volume for last hit sounds.

settings.label: Killsound Pitch Min Damage
settings.tooltip: Kill sound pitch for last hits that deal 10 damage or less. Pitch scales between high and low values. (Recommended: 155)

settings.label: Killsound Pitch Max Damage
settings.tooltip: Kill sound pitch for last hits that deal 150 damage or more. Pitch scales between high and low values. (Recommended: 50)

settings.label: Enable Hitmarker
settings.tooltip: Display a hitmarker on your crosshair upon dealing damage or killing an enemy.

settings.label: Enable Damage Numbers
settings.tooltip: If set, you'll see damage amounts appear over the heads of enemies whenever you damage them.

settings.label: Combine Damage Numbers
settings.tooltip: Controls how damage numbers are combined when multiple hits are made in quick succession.

options.label: Individual
options.tooltip: Each damage number is shown separately.

options.label: Combined
options.tooltip: Damage numbers are combined into a single number.

options.label: Individual+Combined
options.tooltip: Each damage number is shown separately and added into a combined number.

settings.label: Damage Number Combine Time
settings.tooltip: The time window (in seconds) during which multiple damage numbers will be combined into a single number.

settings.label: Large Damage Numbers
settings.tooltip: Whether to always increase the size of the damage numbers, or just upon a critical hit.

settings.label: Damage Number Red
settings.tooltip: Change the color of text that appears over your target's head.

settings.label: Damage Number Green
settings.tooltip: Change the color of text that appears over your target's head.

settings.label: Damage Number Blue
settings.tooltip: Change the color of text that appears over your target's head.

settings.label: Enable Healing Numbers
settings.tooltip: Shows health restored over heal targets similarly to damage numbers.

settings.label: Viewmodel Field of View
settings.tooltip: The Field-of-View to use when drawing the first person view of your active weapon. Larger values will make the weapon smaller onscreen.

settings.label: Flip Viewmodels
settings.tooltip: If set, the first person view of your active weapon will be drawn on the left hand side of the screen, instead of the right.

settings.label: Use Minimized Viewmodels
settings.tooltip: If set, the first person view of your active weapon will be drawn using minimal screen space.

settings.label: Auto-Kill After Choosing a Player Class
settings.tooltip: If set, then you'll immediately die whenever you change class while out in the field. If unset, you'll change to your new class the next time you respawn or touch a resupply cabinet.

settings.label: Auto-Respawn After Loadout Changes in Respawn Rooms
settings.tooltip: If set, then you'll respawn immediately whenever you change your loadout while inside a respawn zone. If unset, your loadout changes will take effect the next time you respawn or touch a resupply cabinet.

settings.label: Remember the Active Weapon Between Lives
settings.tooltip: If set, you'll respawn holding the same weapon you were holding when you died (assuming you still have it equipped in your loadout).

settings.label: Remember the 'Previous Weapon' Between Lives
settings.tooltip: If set, respawning won't affect the weapon you'll switch to when you hit your 'previous weapon' key. If unset, your 'previous weapon' will always be set to be your secondary weapon when you respawn.

settings.label: Medigun continues healing without holding down fire button
settings.tooltip: If set, your Medic's medigun will stay locked onto your heal target until you press the fire button again. If unset, you'll be required to hold the button down to keep the medigun locked on.

settings.label: Display a Marker Over The Player You Are Healing
settings.tooltip: If set, a marker will be displayed above the friendly target that you're currently healing with your medigun.

settings.label: Enable injured teammate indicator
settings.tooltip: If set, you'll receive an automatic request for assistance from any nearby teammates when their health falls below a threshold.

settings.label: Injured teammate health percentage
settings.tooltip: The threshold at which your teammates will automatically request assistance.

settings.label: Play a Sound When the Sniper Rifle is Fully Charged
settings.tooltip: If set, the Sniper rifle will automatically play a sound when fully charged.

settings.label: Sniper Rifle Zoom Behavior
settings.tooltip: Control how the sniper rifle zoom functions.

options.label: Toggle Zoom
options.tooltip: Toggle zooming upon a press of the zoom key.

options.label: Hold to Zoom
options.tooltip: Hold the zoom key to maintain zooming. Will maintain a zoom between shots if held.

settings.label: Hide Crosshair When Zoomed In
settings.tooltip: If set, when zoomed in with any sniper rifles, the default and custom crosshairs will automatically disappear leaving only the rifle targeting laser.

settings.label: Concise Disguise Menu
settings.tooltip: The Concise Disguise Menu for the Spy is an alternate menu that requires more keypresses in the disguising process, but only uses the number keys 1 through 4.

settings.label: Show Revolver Accuracy
settings.tooltip: Whether to adjust the size of the crosshair when your revolver cannot headshot / is not perfectly accurate.

settings.label: Show Non-Standard Items on Spectated Player
settings.tooltip: If set, you'll be shown the loadout items being used by the player you're spectating.

settings.label: Use Advanced Spectator HUD in Tournament Mode
settings.tooltip: The Advanced Spectator HUD is used in tournament mode only, and is designed to show you more information in 6 v 6 matches.

settings.label: When Spectating, View World From the Eyes of a Pyro
settings.tooltip: If set, world will be viewed under Pyrovision when spectating

options.label: Manual
options.tooltip: Recordings can be started/stopped using the ds_record/ds_stop commands.

options.label: Auto-Record Matchmaking Matches
options.tooltip: Gameplay will be recorded when on an official matchmaking server.

options.label: Auto-Record All Matches
options.tooltip: All gameplay will be recorded on any server.

options.label: Auto-Record Tournament Matches
options.tooltip: Record when the server is using mp_tournament.

options.label: Auto-Record Competitive Matches
options.tooltip: Gameplay will be recorded on official or community competitive servers.

settings.label: Play Sounds For Start/Stop Events
settings.tooltip: If set, sounds will play when demo recording starts or stops

settings.label: Log Events
settings.tooltip: If set, all events are logged to the general _events.txt file and to a specific .json file that contains the events for each associated .dem file

settings.label: Auto-Save a Scoreboard Screenshot at the End of a Match
Min Killstreak Count
settings.tooltip: This is the minimum killstreak count before the killstreaks are logged. 0 to disable killstreak logging.

settings.label: Max Time Between Kills
settings.tooltip: This is the maximum time between kills before the killstreak count is reset to zero.

settings.label: Auto-Delete Recordings
settings.tooltip: Auto-delete recordings with no associated bookmark or kill streak events

settings.label: Network Quality
settings.tooltip: Select how the game should account for your network quality. Lower settings may increase latency but improve overall stability.

options.label: Poor
options.tooltip: I have a poor quality network.

options.label: Okay
options.tooltip: I have an okay quality network.

options.label: High-end
options.tooltip: I have a high quality network.

settings.label: Bandwidth
settings.tooltip: Select the bandwidth setting that best matches your internet download speed.

settings.label: Custom Files
settings.tooltip: When a game server tries to download custom content to your computer, you can control what files to allow to download.

options.label: Allow all custom files from server
Do not download any custom files

settings.label: Show Network Information
settings.tooltip: If set, network performance information such as ping and packet loss will be displayed on the HUD.

settings.label: Field of View (FOV)
settings.tooltip: The field of view of your camera. Higher values allow you to see more of the world, but feel further away.

settings.label: Main Volume
settings.tooltip: The main volume of the game. All other volume settings are relative to this.

settings.label: Music Volume
settings.tooltip: The volume of music on the main menu and in-game.

settings.label: Voice Receive Volume
settings.tooltip: Adjust the volume of other players' voices.

settings.label: Enable 3D Sound
settings.tooltip: If set, enables 3D stereo spatial effects. Recommended for headphones only.

settings.label: Enable enhanced audio effects
settings.tooltip: If set, enables enhanced audio effects based upon the size and type of the in-game environment you are standing in.

settings.label: Play Sound in Desktop
settings.tooltip: Play sound even when the game is in the background

settings.label: Enable text chat
settings.tooltip: If set, allow in-game text communication

settings.label: Text Filter Settings
settings.tooltip: Open Steam chat and text filter settings

settings.label: Enable voice chat
settings.tooltip: If set, allow in-game voice communication
